intro: Tryphostemma sandersonii, commonly known as the sandersonii morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in the morning. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and is typically found in rocky or sandy soils. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar climbing or trailing growth habits. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
